page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This is a rural area comprising of the scarp slope of the Lincoln Wolds at its eastern extremity with a section of the Vale of Ancholm to the west. The thin soils of the Wolds contrasts with the thick clays overlain with sands of the Vale The two settlements of{Caistor}and { {Nettleton}are sited on the scarp slope;Caistor at a height of 76 metres and Nettleton at 45 metres.The rest of the area consists mainly of dispersed farms. Caistor is a small,attractive nucleated market town of Roman origin. It is visited by hikers walking the {Viking Way}which passes through the {Water Hills}a local beauty spot to the north of the town where a number of springs rise.
